oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from J. S. Harrison to wife
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter to "Dear, Dear Wife" (J. E. Harrison) written by a soldier from Camp Jackson, 15 miles from Gallatin. The writer is enjoying good health, but wants to see his wife very much. "[I]t want be long till I will come to hold you to my bosem, the darling of my heart" He writes of the election of officers and brags, "We have the best company in camp." See also whit 003.
